page.title: 16Nether Stowey:Fire Service
page.content: In 1969 the Somerset Fire Service opened the village station. Fourteen part time firemen living close by give a 24 hour service. After a 999 call the main control station sends a radio frequency signal to a special receiver at our fire station. This activates all personal alerters which the firemen carry at all times. Some people think that the siren was best for alerting the whole village and clearing the streets of traffic. The siren now belongs to the Ministry of Defence. The station also has a monitor for radiation leaks into the atmosphere (NB proximity of nuclear power station).A large water tender, with a 13.5m ladder, holds 1800 litres of water. A special Landrover carrying a 250 litre water bag and pump has easier access to remote hill areas.70- 80 fires,mostly domestic/farm, a year.
